result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Ryan M Clemens appeared by video, in custody from Walworth County Jail. .  Attorney Daryl W Laatsch in court for Ryan M Clemens.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Hearing on November 21, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears via video in custody from the Walworth County Jail and by Atty. Daryl Laatsch.  Per Atty. Laatsch, pending cases in Walworth County set for mid-September.  State has no objection to an adjournment.  Defendant to appear via video.  Hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Hearing on September 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Confirmed defendant's zoom video appearance for 8/3/22 hearing with Walworth Co Jail.

Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ryan M Clemens appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Daryl W Laatsch in court for Ryan M Clemens.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing. Defendant has pending cases in several counties and awaiting for resolution in Walworth county case. Defendant to appear by video for adjourned hearing. 
Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Hearing on August 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting Attorney Elizabeth A. Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears via video in custody from Walworth County Jail.  Reading of Information waived.  Defense requests defendant stand silent.  Court enters not guilty pleas.  Defendant to appear by zoom.
Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Hearing on July 6, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Prosecuting Attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears in custody from the Washington County Jail and by Attorney Daryl W. Laatsch.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  Defendant is currently being held in Walworth County Jail and requests a zoom appearance.  Court will allow a zoom appearance for the next court hearing.
Arraignment scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Arraignment on June 1, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety; No contact with Wash Cty Fleet Farms

Prosecuting Mark Bensen appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears via video in custody from the Washington County Jail and by Atty. Andrew Leech in person.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Argument on bond.  $250 cash bond set.  Defendant eligible for State Public Defender.   Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Initial appearance on April 4, 2022 at 08:15 am. Not sent opened in branch 4 in error.
